change.item:
$Log: ml.xml,v $ Revision 1.4 2004/12/14 19:42:20 packel added entry/sense ids; fixed bad empty tags
Revision 1.3 2004/12/03 20:11:37 packel corrected some duplicate keys caused by fixing the compound verbs
Revision 1.2 2004/12/02 23:29:11 packel added key attributes to compound verb entries
Revision 1.1 2004/11/22 17:07:40 packel converted to P4/XML
Revision 1.20 2004/10/18 18:17:47 packel added div0s; changed orth ʼa)da/mas,ʼ to a)da/mas
Revision 1.19 2004/10/07 14:18:11 packel removed *s in entry keys
Revision 1.18 2004/10/05 21:34:13 packel Aligned dictionary entries with the LSJ.
Revision 1.17 2004/09/08 15:49:42 packel Changed doctype to TEI P4
Revision 1.16 2004/09/01 15:44:25 packel Fixed thirty-odd words that had multiple entries but no number afterward to differentiate the entries (e.g., si=gma, si=gma is now si=gma1, si=gma2).
Revision 1.15 2004/06/15 19:31:34 lcerrato changed nothwithstanding to notwithstanding
Revision 1.14 2003/02/04 21:21:51 lcerrato fixed typo kuma entry swoln to swollen
Revision 1.13 2001/12/05 15:15:58 gcrane shifted the lemma for "pa/nth" to be "pa/nth|"
Revision 1.12 2001/04/20 21:58:57 dasmith Added funder.
Revision 1.11 2001/04/05 18:26:02 lcerrato added trans tags to noeo^ entry where missing
Revision 1.10 2000/10/06 23:20:04 dasmith Tagged inflectional info as Greek.
Revision 1.9 2000/10/06 21:44:13 dasmith Added author and ISBN to head. Use new DTD subset. Explicitly tag lemmata and cross references as Greek.
Revision 1.8 2000/03/04 20:25:11 dasmith Standardized language IDs. Added key attribute to entry.
Revision 1.7 1998/08/24 19:15:31 jrydberg finished trans tags and added new prep. defs.
Revision 1.6 1998/08/20 17:12:45 jrydberg Included greek words within trans tags where appropriate
Revision 1.5 1998/08/19 20:50:08 jrydberg Replaced all "(trans) or (/trans)" with " or "
Revision 1.4 1998/08/19 18:23:58 jrydberg Corrected trans tagging for short defs. through a)mfote/rwqen.
Revision 1.3 1998/08/17 20:24:43 jrydberg *** empty log message ***
Revision 1.2 1998/08/17 19:38:25 jrydberg Updated entry for *)agamemno/neos
Revision 1.1 1998/08/14 15:38:33 textgod Added to repository.

div1.head: ψαίρω
div1.sense: trans. to graze, scrape, touch gently, οἶμον αἰθέρος ψαίρει is ready to skim the path of ether, Aesch.
intr. to move lightly, flutter, rustle, murmur, Luc.

div1.head: ψαιστός
div1.sense: τὰ ψαιστά(sc. πόπανα) cakes of ground barley, used at sacrifices, Ar.

div1.head: ψαίστωρ
div1.sense: one that wipes off, Anth.

div1.head: ψακάζω
div1.sense: to rain in small drops, drizzle, drip, Ar.: impers., ψακάζει it drizzles.

div1.head: ψακάς
div1.sense: any small piece broken off, a grain, morsel, bit, ἀργυρίου μηδὲ ψακάς, i.e. not even a silver penny, Ar.; collectively, ψάμμου ψεκάς grains of sand, Anth.

a drop of rain; and collectively, drizzling rain, ὕσθησαν αἱ Θῆβαι ψακάδι Hdt.; ψακὰς δὲ λήγει drops are ceasing, i.e. a storm is coming, Aesch.:—generally, rain, Eur.; ψακάδι φοινίας δρόσου with a sprinkling of bloody dew, Aesch.
Comic name for a sputterer, Ar.

div1.head: ψαλιδόστομος
div1.sense: nipper-mouthed, of a crab, Batr.

div1.head: ψαλίζω
div1.sense: to clip with scissors, Babr.

div1.head: ψάλιον
div1.sense: part of the bridle, a kind of curb-chain, Xen.; ψαλίοις ἐδάμασε πώλους Eur.
generally, a chain, bond, Aesch.; metaph., of a person, ψ. οἰκετῶν a curb upon the household, Aesch.

div1.head: ψαλίς
div1.sense: a pair of scissors, Lat. forfex, Anth.
a building with a pointed stone roof, a vault, Lat. fornix, Soph.

div1.head: ψάλλω
div1.sense: to touch sharply, to pluck, pull, twitch, Aesch.; τόξου νευρὰν ψ. to twang the bow-string, Eur.; βέλος ἐκ κέραος ψ. to send a shaft twanging from the bow, Anth.; so, σχοῖνος μιλτοφυρὴς ψαλλομένη a carpenterʼs red line, which is twitched and then suddenly let go, so as to leave a mark, Anth.
to play a stringed instrument with the fingers, not with the plectron, Hdt., Ar., Plat.
later, to sing to a harp, sing, NTest.

div1.head: ψάλμα
div1.sense: a tune for a stringed instrument, Anth.

div1.head: ψαλμός
div1.sense: a twitching or twanging with the fingers, of a bow, Eur.
mostly of musical strings: the sound of the harp, Pind., Aesch.
later, a song sung to the harp, a psalm, NTest.

div1.head: ψαλμοχαρής
div1.sense: delighting in harp-playing, Anth.

div1.head: ψάλτρια
div1.sense: a female harper, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ψάμαθος
div1.sense: sand, sea-sand, Hom., Soph., etc.; in pl., νῆα ἐπὶ ψαμάθοις on the sands, Hom.
proverb. of a countless multitude, ὅσα ψάμαθός τε κόνις τε Il.; in pl. grains of sand, Il.

div1.head: ψαμαθώδης
div1.sense: sandy, Hhymn.

div1.head: ψαμμακοσιογάργαροι
div1.sense: exaggerated comic form in sand-hundred heaps, Ar.

div1.head: ψαμμακόσιοι
div1.etym: the proper form is ψαμμακόσιοι not ψαμμοκόσιοι
div1.sense: sand-hundred, a Comic word formed from ψάμμος, ἑκατόν, after the analogy of the cardinal numbers διακόσιοι, τριακόσιοι (from δὶς ἑκατόν, τρὶς ἑκατόν), to denote a countless multitude, Eupol.

div1.head: ψάμμινος
div1.sense: of sand, sandy, Hdt.

div1.head: ψάμμιος
div1.sense: on the sand, Aesch.

div1.head: ψαμμίτης
div1.sense: sand, sandy, Anth.

div1.head: ψάμμος
div1.sense: sand, so called from its loose, crumbling nature (from ψάω), Od., etc.:—proverb., ψάμμος ἀριθμὸν περιπέφευγεν Pind.
ἡ ψ. the sandy desert of Libya, Hdt.
div1.etym: Both ψάμμος and ψάμαθος sometimes drop ψ and become ἄμμος, ἄμαθος.

div1.head: ψαμμώδης
div1.sense: like sand, sandy, Hdt.

div1.head: ψαρός
div1.sense: like a starling, i. e. speckled, dappled, ψ. ἵππος a dapple-gray horse, Ar.

div1.head: ψάρ
div1.sense: a starling, mentioned as flying in a cloud, ψηρῶν νέφος Il.

div1.head: ψαῦσις
div1.sense: a touching, Plut.

div1.head: ψαύω
div1.sense: to touch, c. gen., Il., etc.; c. dat. instrumenti, Il.; χεροῖν ἔψαυσα πηγῆς Aesch.: but ψαύειν τινι to to touch a thing, Pind.: —in Soph. it seems to be used c. acc., κεῖνος ψαύων τὸν θεόν assailing the god, Antig. 961; but Soph. Antig. 857, ἔψαυσας μερίμνας, πατρὸς οἶτον thou didst touch on a theme of grief, —my fatherʼs fate, — μερίμνας is gen., and οἶτον acc. in apposition.
to touch as an enemy, lay hands upon, τινός Eur.
to touch, reach, affect, ἄκρας καρδίας ἔψαυσέ μου Eur.:—Mid. also, to reach, gain, Pind.

div1.head: ψαφαρόθριξ
div1.sense: with rough coat, Hhymn.

div1.head: ψαφαρός
div1.sense: easily reduced to powder, friable, crumbling, Aesch., Anth.; ἡ ψαφαρή the sandy shore, Anth.
of liquids, thin, watery, Anth.

div1.head: ψαφαρόχροος
div1.sense: rough on the surface, squalid, Eur.

div1.head: ψάω
div1.sense: to touch lightly, rub;
intr. to crumble away, vanish, disappear, Soph.

div1.head: ψέγω
div1.sense: to blame, censure, τινά Theogn., etc.;— ψ. τινὰ περί τινος to blame one for a thing, Plat.; διά τι Plat.; ἐπί τινι Xen.;—also, c. dupl. acc., Soph.; ἃ ψέγομεν τὸν Ἔρωτα Plat.:—Pass., ἡ ἐπιείκεια οὐ ψέγεται there is no objection to it, we find no fault with it, Thuc.

div1.head: ψεδνός
div1.sense: thin, spare, scanty, of hair, Il., Anth.; of a person, bald-headed, Luc.

div1.head: ψέκτης
div1.sense: a censurer, disparager, Plat.

div1.head: ψεκτός
div1.sense: blamed, blameable, Plat.

div1.head: ψέλιον
div1.sense: an armlet or anklet, Lat. armilla, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ψελιοφόρος
div1.sense: wearing bracelets, Hdt.

div1.head: ψελιόω
div1.sense: to twine, ψ. αὐχένα στεφάνοις Anth.

div1.head: ψελλίζω
div1.sense: to falter in speech, speak inarticulately:—so in Mid., Plat., Arist.

div1.head: ψελλισμός
div1.sense: a pronouncing indistinctly: metaph., ποδάγρας ψ. unpronounced (i. e. suppressed) gout, Plut.

div1.head: ψελλός
div1.sense: unable to pronounce certain letters, Arist.
pass. of words, inarticulate, obscure, Aesch.

div1.head: ψευδαγγελέω
div1.sense: to bring false news, Ar.

div1.head: ψευδαγγελία
div1.sense: a false report, Xen.

div1.head: ψευδάγγελος
div1.sense: a false or lying messenger, Il.

div1.head: ψευδάδελφος
div1.sense: a false brother, NTest.

div1.head: ψευδαμάμαξυς
div1.sense: a bastard vine, Ar.

div1.head: ψευδαπόστολος
div1.sense: a false apostle, NTest.

div1.head: Ψευδαρτάβας
div1.sense: Comic name of a mock Persian, false-measure, Ar.

div1.head: ψευδατράφαξυς
div1.sense: false orach, Comic name of a plant, Ar.

div1.head: ψευδαττικός
div1.sense: false Attic, Luc.

div1.head: ψευδαυτόμολος
div1.sense: a sham deserter, Xen.

div1.head: ψευδενέδρα
div1.sense: a feigned ambuscade, Xen.

div1.head: ψευδηγορέω
div1.sense: to speak falsely, Aesch.

div1.head: ψευδηγόρος
div1.sense: speaking falsely, Anth.

div1.head: ψευδής
div1.sense: lying, false, Lat. mendax, Hes., etc.; ἐπὶ ψευδῆ ὁδὸν τρέπεσθαι to betake oneself to lying ways, Hdt.

of persons, lying, and as Subst. a liar, οὐ γὰρ ἐπὶ ψευδέσσι πατὴρ Ζεὺς ἔσσετʼ ἀρωγός Zeus will not assist lying men (others read ἐπὶ ψεύδεσσι from ψεῦδος, will not assist lies); ψ. φαίνεσθαι to be detected in falsehood, Thuc.
τὰ ψευδῆ falsehoods, lies, ψευδῆ λέγειν Aesch., Ar.
pass. belied, beguiled, deceived, Eur.
adv. falsely, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ψευδοβοήθεια
div1.sense: pretended help, Xen.

div1.head: ψευδοδιδάσκαλος
div1.sense: a false teacher, NTest.

div1.head: ψευδοκῆρυξ
div1.sense: a lying herald, Soph.

div1.head: ψευδοκλητεία
div1.sense: a prosecution against one who has falsely subscribed his name as witness, γραφὴ ψευδοκλητείας a prosecution for such false subscription, Dem.

div1.head: ψευδοκύων
div1.sense: a sham Cynic, Plut.

div1.head: ψευδόλιτρος
div1.sense: ψ. κονία lie or soap made from adulterated soda, Ar.

div1.head: ψευδολογέω
div1.sense: to speak falsely, spread false reports, Isocr., Aeschin.

div1.head: ψευδολογία
div1.sense: a false speech, falsehood, Isocr., Dem.

div1.head: ψευδολόγος
div1.sense: speaking falsely, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: ψευδόμαντις
div1.sense: a false prophet, Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: ψευδομαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to be a false witness, bear false witness, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ψευδομαρτυρία
div1.sense: false witness, Dem.: mostly in gen. pl., ψευδομαρτυριῶν δίκη a prosecution for false witness, Isae., etc.; ψευδομαρτυριῶν ἐπισκήπτεσθαί τινι to make allegation of perjury against one, Dem.

div1.head: ψευδομάρτυς
div1.sense: a false witness, Plat.

div1.head: ψευδονέρων
div1.sense: a false-Nero, Luc.

div1.head: ψευδονύμφευτος
div1.sense: ψευδο-νύμφευτος, γάμος, ὁ, a false, feigned marriage, Eur.

div1.head: ψευδοπάρθενος
div1.sense: a pretended maid or virgin, Hdt.

div1.head: ψευδόρκιος
div1.sense: perjured, forsworn, Hdt.

div1.head: ψεῦδος
div1.sense: a falsehood, untruth, lie, Hom., etc.; εἴτε ψεῦδος ὑπόσχεσις ἠὲ καὶ οὐχί whether the promise be a lie or no, Il.
pl., ψεύδεα spots, pimples on the nose, Theocr.

div1.head: ψευδοστομέω
div1.sense: to speak falsely, Soph.

div1.head: ψευδόφημος
div1.sense: of false divination, Soph.

div1.head: ψευδοφίλιππος
div1.sense: a false Philip, Luc.

div1.head: ψευδόχριστος
div1.sense: a false Christ, NTest.

div1.head: ψευδώνυμος
div1.sense: under a false name, falsely called, Aesch. adv. -μως, by a false name, Aesch.

div1.head: ψεύδω
div1.sense: to cheat by lies, beguile, Soph., etc.:—Pass. to be cheated, deceived, Aesch, etc.

ψ. τινά τινος to cheat, balk, disappoint one of a thing, Aesch., Soph.; also c. acc. rei, ἐλπίδας ψ. τινά Xen.:—Pass. to be cheated, balked, disappointed of a thing, ψευσθῆναι ἐλπίδος, γάμου Hdt.; δείπνου Ar.

Pass., also, to be deceived, mistaken in or about a thing, ἐψευσμένοι γνώμης mistaken in opinion, Hdt.; ἐψευσμένοι τῆς τῶν Ἀθηναίων δυνάμεως deceived in their notions of the Athenian power, Thuc.; ἐψεῦσθαι ἑαυτῶν, Opp. to εἰδέναι ἑαυτούς, Xen.:—also, ψευσθῆναι ἔν τινι Hdt.; περί τινος Xen.: also c. acc., αὐτοὺς ἐψευσμένη Ἑλλάς deceived in its estimate of them, Thuc.
of statements, to be untrue, ἡ τρίτη τῶν ὁδῶν μάλιστα ἔψευσται Hdt.
c. acc. rei, like ψευδοποιέω, to represent a thing as a lie, to falsify, Soph.:—Pass., ἡ ψευσθεῖσα ὑπόσχεσις the promise broken, Thuc.
earlier and more common is the Dep. ψεύδομαι, Ep. imper. ψεύδεο· f. ψεύσομαι· aor. 1 ἐψευσάμην· pf. ἔψευσμαι·
absol. to lie, speak false, play false, Hom., etc.
c. acc. rei, to say that which is untrue, ὅτι τοῦτο ψεύδομαι Plat.; ἅπερ αὐτὸν οὐ ψεύδομαι which I do not speak falsely about him, Andoc.
to be false, perjured or forsworn, Hes.

like Act. II, to belie, falsify, ὅρκια ψεύσασθαι to break them, Il.; so, ψ. γάμους Eur.; so in plqpf. pass., ἔψευστο τὴν ξυμμαχίαν Thuc.; τὰ χρήματα ἐψευσμένοι ἦσαν had broken their word about the money, Xen.
like Act. 1, to deceive by lies, cheat, Aesch., Eur.; ψ. τινά τι to deceive one in a thing, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ψεύδω
div1.sense: to cheat by lies, beguile, Soph., etc.:—Pass. to be cheated, deceived, Aesch., etc.

ψ. τινά τινος to cheat, balk, disappoint one of a thing, Aesch., Soph.; also c. acc. rei, ἐλπίδας ψ. τινά Xen.: —Pass. to be cheated, balked, disappointed of a thing, ψευσθῆναι ἐλπίδος, γάμου Hdt.; δείπνου Ar.

Pass., also, to be deceived, mistaken in or about a thing, ἐψευσμένοι γνώμης mistaken in opinion, Hdt.; ἐψευσμένοι τῆς τῶν Ἀθηναίων δυνάμεως deceived in their notions of the Athenian power, Thuc.; ἐψεῦσθαι ἑαυτῶν, Opp. to εἰδέναι ἑαυτούς, Xen.:—also, ψευσθῆναι ἔν τινι Hdt.; περί τινος Xen.: also c. acc., αὐτοὺς ἐψευσμένη Ἑλλάς deceived in its estimate of them, Thuc.
of statements, to be untrue, ἡ τρίτη τῶν ὁδῶν μάλιστα ἔψευσται Hdt.
c. acc. rei, like ψευδοποιέω, to represent a thing as a lie, to falsify, Soph.:—Pass., ἡ ψευσθεῖσα ὑπόσχεσις the promise broken, Thuc.
earlier and more common is the Mid. ψεύδομαι
absol. to lie, speak false, play false, Hom., etc.
c. acc. rei, to say that which is untrue, ὅτι τοῦτο ψεύδομαι Plat.; ἅπερ αὐτὸν οὐ ψεύδομαι which I do not speak falsely about him, Andoc.
to be false, perjured or forsworn, Hes.

like Act. II, to belie, falsify, ὅρκια ψεύσασθαι to break them, Il.; so, ψ. γάμους Eur.; so in plup. pass., ἔψευστο τὴν ξυμμαχίαν Thuc.; τὰ χρήματα ἐψευσμένοι ἦσαν had broken their word about the money, Xen.
like Act. I, to deceive by lies, cheat, Aesch., Eur.; ψ. τινά τι to deceive one in a thing, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ψευσίστυξ
div1.sense: hating falsehood, Anth.

div1.head: ψεῦσμα
div1.sense: a lie, untruth, Plat.

div1.head: ψευστέω
div1.sense: to be a liar, lie, cheat, Il.

div1.head: ψεύστης
div1.sense: a liar, cheat, Il., etc.
as adj., like ψευδής, lying, false, Pind., Anth.

div1.head: ψεφαυγής
div1.sense: dark-gleaming, i.e. glimmering, gloomy, Eur.

div1.head: ψεφηνός
div1.sense: dark, obscure, of a person, Pind.

div1.head: ψέφος
div1.sense: darkness, Alcae.

div1.head: ψῆγμα
div1.sense: that which is rubbed or scraped off, shavings, scrapings, chips, Lat. ramentum, ψ. (with or without χρυσοῦ) gold dust, Hdt.; ψ. πυρωθέν, i. e. dust and ashes, Aesch.

div1.head: ψήκτρα
div1.sense: an instrument used by bathers, a scraper, like στλεγγίς, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: ψηλαφάω
div1.sense: to feel or grope about (Epic for -άων) , of the blinded Cyclops, Od.; ψηλαφῶντες ὥσπερ ἐν σκότῳ Plat.
div1.etym: like a blind man or one in the dark, χερσὶ ψηλαφόων
div1.sense: c. acc. rei, to feel about for, search after, Ar., NTest.
to feel, touch, stroke, Xen., NTest.

div1.head: ψηλάφημα
div1.sense: a touch, a caress, Xen.

div1.head: ψηνίζω
div1.sense: to Psenize, alluding to the Ψῆνες, a Comedy by Magnes, Ar.

div1.head: ψήν
div1.sense: the gall-insect, which livesin the fruit of the wild fig and male palm, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ψῆξις
div1.sense: a rubbing down, currying, Xen.

div1.head: ψῆττα
div1.sense: a flat-fish such as a plaice, sole, turbot, Lat. rhombus, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ψηττόποδες
div1.sense: turbot-footed, name of a fabulous people, Luc.

div1.head: ψηφίζω
div1.sense: to count or reckon, properly with pebbles ( ψῆφοι, cf. Lat calculare from calculus), Anth.
Act can mean to vote, like ψηφίζομαι, but only in Soph. (δίκην ἐψήφισαν), and in late writers.
more freq. Dep. ψηφίζομαι.
properly, to give oneʼs vote with a pebble, which was thrown into the voting urn, absol., ψηφίζεσθαι ἐς ὑδρίαν Xen.: generally, to vote, Hdt.; τινι for any one, Dem.
c. acc. rei, to vote for, carry by vote, πόλεμον Thuc.; ψ. παρασκευήν Thuc., etc.
c. inf. to vote, give oneʼs vote to do a thing, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—c. acc. et inf. to vote that, ψ. τὰς σπονδὰς λελύσθαι Thuc.
ψ. περί, ὑπέρ τινος Plat., Aeschin.

Act. in same sense as Mid., only in Soph. Aj. (δίκην ἐψήφισαν), and in late writers:—but the aor1 pass. ψηφισθῆναι is used in pass. sense, to be voted, Thuc., Xen., etc.; so perf. part. ἐψηφισμένοι θανεῖν condemned by vote to die, Eur.

div1.head: ψήφισμα
div1.sense: a proposition carried by vote: esp. a measure passed in the ἐκκλησία, a decree, Ar.; τὸ Μεγαρέων ψ. the decree concerning them, Thuc.; so, περὶ Μεγαρέων ψ. Thuc.; ψ. γράφειν to bring in a decree, Ar., Dem.; ψ. ἐπιψηφίζειν, of the πρόεδροι, to put it to the vote, Aeschin.; ψ. νικᾶν to carry it, Aeschin.; ψ. καθαιρεῖν to rescind it, Lat. abrogare, Thuc.

div1.head: ψηφισματοπώλης
div1.sense: a decree-monger, Ar.

div1.head: ψηφισματώδης
div1.sense: of the nature of a decree, Arist.

div1.head: ψηφίς
div1.sense: a small pebble, Il., Luc.
a pebble for reckoning, Anth.

div1.head: ψηφοποιός
div1.sense: making votes or tampering with them, Soph.

div1.head: ψῆφος
div1.sense: a small stone, a pebble, rubbed and rounded in river-beds or on the sea-shore, Lat. calculus, Pind., Hdt.

a pebble used for reckoning, a counter, ψήφοις λογίζεσθαι to calculate by arithmetic, to cipher, Hdt.; hence to reckon exactly or accurately, Ar.; ἐν ψήφῳ λέγειν Aesch.:— in pl. accounts, καθαραὶ ψῆφοι an exact balance, Dem.
a pebble used for playing at draughts, Plat.

a pebble used in voting, which was thrown into the voting-urn (ὑδρία) , Hdt., Attic; ψῆφον φέρειν to give oneʼs vote, Lat. suffragium ferre, Aesch., etc.; so, ψῆφον τίθεσθαι Hdt.:— ψήφῳ κρίνειν, διακρίνειν to determine by vote, Thuc., etc.:—in collective sense, ψ. γίγνεται περί τινος a vote is taken, Antipho.; ἡ σώζουσα, ἡ καθαιροῦσα ψῆφος the vote of acquittal, of condemnation, Lys., Dem.:— τὴν ψῆφον ἐπάγειν to put the vote or question, like ἐπιψηφίζειν, Thuc. b. that which is carried by vote, ψ. καταγνώσεως a vote of condemnation, Thuc.; ψῆφος περὶ φυγῆς a vote of banishment, Xen. c. any resolve or decree, e. g. of a king, Soph.; λιθίνα ψᾶφος a decree written on stone, Pind.; διδοῖ ψᾶφον παρʼ αὐτᾶς [the oak] gives judgment of itself, Pind. d. ψῆφος Ἀθηνᾶς, calculus Minervae, a proverb. phrase to express acquittal.—the vote by ψῆφος, ballot, must be distinguished from that by κύαμος, lot; the former being used in trials, the latter in elections.
the place of voting (as πεσσοί for the place of play), Eur.

div1.head: ψηφοφορέω
div1.sense: to give oneʼs vote, vote, Luc.

div1.head: ψηφοφορία
div1.sense: vote by ballot, Arist.: generally, voting, Plut.

div1.head: ψήχω
div1.sense: to rub down, curry a horse, Xen.: — to stroke, pat, Lat. mulcere, Eur.
to rub down, wear away, Anth.

div1.head: ψίαθος
div1.sense: a rush mat, Ar.; Doric pl. acc. ψιάθως, Ar.

div1.head: ψιάς
div1.sense: a drop, Il.

div1.head: ψίζω
div1.sense: to feed on pap:—Pass. to be so fed, Anth.

div1.head: ψιθυρίζω
div1.sense: to whisper, say into the ear, Plat., Theocr.:—metaph., ὅταν πλάτανος πτελέᾳ ψιθυρίζῃ when the plane whispers to the elm, Ar.

div1.head: ψιθύρισμα
div1.sense: a whispering, Anth.: of trees rustling, Theocr.

div1.head: ψιθυρισμός
div1.sense: a whispering, Luc.
whispering, slandering, NTest.

div1.head: ψιθυριστής
div1.sense: a whisperer: a slanderer, NTest.

div1.head: ψίθυρος
div1.sense: whispering: slanderous, Soph.
as Subst., ψίθυρος, ψιθυριστής, a whisperer, slanderer, Pind.
twittering, of birds, Anth.

div1.head: ψιλικός
div1.sense: of or for a light-armed soldier (ψιλός) : τὰ ψιλικά, = οἱ ψιλοί, the light troops, Luc.

div1.head: ψιλομετρία
div1.sense: heroic poetry, as not being accompanied by music (v. ψιλός iv. 2), Arist.

div1.head: ψιλός
div1.sense: bare,

of land, ψιλὴ ἄροσις a bare corn-field, Il.; πεδίον μέγα τε καὶ ψιλόν Hdt.: c. gen., γῆ ψιλὴ δενδρέων land bare of trees, Hdt.:— ψιλὴ γεωργία the tillage of land for corn, opp. to γ. πεφυτευμένη (for vines and olives), Arist.
of animals, stript of hair or feathers, bare, smooth, δέρμα Od.; ἶβις ψιλὴ κεφαλήν bald on the head, Hdt.

generally, bare, uncovered, ψιλὸν ὡς ὁρᾷ νέκυν Soph.:—c. gen. bare of, separated from, ψιλὴ σώματος οὖσα ἡ ψυχή Plat. b. bare, stript of appendages, ψιλὴ τρόπις the bare keel with the planks torn from it, Od.; ψ. θρίδαξ a lettuce with the side-leaves pulled off, Hdt.; ψ. μάχαιραι swords without other arms, Xen.

οἱ ψιλοί (sc. τῶν ὅπλων) soldiers without heavy armour, light troops, such as archers and slingers, opp. to ὁπλῖται, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; τὸ ψιλόν, opp. to τὸ ὁπλιτικόν, Xen.; ψ. ἔχων τὴν κεφαλήν bare-headed, without helmet, Xen.
ψιλὸς λόγος bare language, i. e. prose, as opp. to poetry which is clothed in metre, Plat.; also, ψ. λόγος is a mere speech, a speech unsupported by evidence, Dem.
ψιλὴ ποίησις mere poetry, without music, i. e. Epic poetry, as opp. to lyric, Plat.:—but, ψιλὴ μουσική instrumental music unaccompanied by the voice, Arist.
Oedipus seems to call Antigone his ψιλὸν ὄμμα, as being the one poor eye left him, Soph.
adv. ψιλῶς, merely, only, Plut.

div1.head: ψιλότης
div1.sense: nakedness, of a plain, Plut.
baldness, Plut.

div1.head: ψιλόω
div1.sense: to strip bare of hair, Hdt.:— Pass. to become bald, Hes.: generally, to be laid bare, Xen.
c. gen. to strip bare of, to strip of a thing, Hdt.
generally, to leave naked, unarmed or defenceless, Thuc.
Pass. also of things, to be stripped off something, τὰ κρέα ἐψιλωμένα τῶν ὀστέων Hdt.

div1.head: ψιλόω
div1.sense: to strip bare of hair, Hdt.:— Pass. to become bald, Hes.: generally, to be laid bare, Xen.
c. gen. to strip bare of, to strip of a thing, Hdt.
generally, to leave naked, unarmed or defenceless, Thuc.
Pass. also of things, to be stripped off something, τὰ κρέα ἐψιλωμένα τῶν ὀστέων Hdt.

div1.head: ψιμύθιον
div1.sense: white lead, used to whiten the face, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ψιμυθιόω
div1.sense: to paint with white lead, τὸ πρόσωπον Plut.:—Pass., perf. inf. ἐψιμυθιῶσθαι Lys.

div1.head: ψ
div1.sense: Ψ, ψ, ψῖ, τό, indecl., twenty-third letter of the Gr. alphabet: as a numeral, ψʹ 700, but ͵ψ 700, 000.— The letter ψ is a double Consonant, compounded of the labial π or φ with ς, πς, φς: the character ψ, ascribed to Simonides, was adopted at Athens in the archonship of Euclides (Ol. 94. 2) at the same time with η, ω, ξ.

div1.head: ψιττακός
div1.sense: a parrot, Plut.; also ψιττάκη, ἡ, Arist.

div1.head: ψιχάρπαξ
div1.sense: crumb-filcher, name of a mouse in Batr.

div1.head: ψιχίον
div1.sense: a crumb of bread, NTest.

div1.head: ψογερός
div1.sense: fond of blaming, censorious, Pind.

div1.head: ψόγιος
div1.sense: fond of blaming, censorious, Pind.

div1.head: ψόγος
div1.sense: a blamable fault, a blemish, flaw, Simon.
blame, censure, Pind., Trag., etc.; ψόγον τινὶ ἐπενεγκεῖν Thuc.

div1.head: ψολόεις
div1.sense: sooty, smoky: as epith. of κεραυνός, smouldering, lurid, Od.

div1.head: ψολοκομπία
div1.sense: smoky (i. e. empty) talk, Ar.

div1.head: ψόλος
div1.sense: soot, smoke, Aesch.

div1.head: ψοφέω
div1.sense: to make an inarticulate noise, to sound, make a noise, Eur.; ψοφεῖ λάλον τι sounds chatter-like, as if it were tested like a pot, to see if it were cracked, Ar.; ὥσπερ κύμβαλον ψοφεῖ Xen.
c. acc., ψοφεῖν τὰς θύρας to knock at the door inside, to shew that some one was coming out, Menand.:—also of the door (intr.), εἰ αἱ θύραι νύκτωρ ψοφοῖεν, i. e. if they were heard to open, Lys.

div1.head: ψοφοδεής
div1.sense: frightened at every noise, shy, timid, Plat.:— τὸ ψοφοδεές timidity, Plut.

div1.head: ψοφομήδης
div1.sense: meditating noise, uproarious, epith. of Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: ψόφος
div1.sense: any inarticulate sound, a sound, noise, Hom., Eur., etc.; of musical instruments, ψ. λωτοῦ, κιθάρας Eur.
a mere sound, empty sound, noise, Soph., Eur.; ψόφου πλέως, of Aeschylus, Ar.

div1.head: ψοφώδης
div1.sense: noisy, Arist.

div1.head: ψυδνός
div1.sense: false, Theogn.

div1.head: ψύθος
div1.sense: a lie, untruth, Aesch.

div1.head: ψυκτήρ
div1.sense: a wine-cooler, a vessel holding from 2 to 6 μετρηταί, Plat.

div1.head: ψύλλα
div1.sense: a flea, Lat. pulex, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ψυλλοτοξότης
div1.sense: a flea-archer, Comic word in Luc. formed like ἱππο-τοξότης.

div1.head: ψυχαγωγέω
div1.sense: to lead departed souls to the nether world, of Hermes, Luc.
metaph. to attract the souls of the living, to win over, persuade, allure, Xen., etc.: in bad sense, to inveigle, delude, Isocr.

div1.head: ψυχαγωγία
div1.sense: a winning of souls, persuasion, Plat.

div1.head: ψυχαγωγικός
div1.sense: attractive, persuasive, Plat.

div1.head: ψυχαγωγός
div1.sense: leading souls to the nether world, of Hermes.
evoking souls to question them, evoking the dead, Aesch.:—as Subst. a necromancer, psychagogue, Eur.

div1.head: ψυχαπάτης
div1.sense: beguiling the soul, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχεινός
div1.sense: cooling, cool, fresh, Xen.

div1.head: ψυχήϊος
div1.sense: alive, living, Pythag. ap. Luc.

div1.head: ψυχή
div1.sense: breath, Lat. anima, esp. as the sign of life, the life, spirit, Hom., etc.; ψυχή τε μένος τε ψυχή τε καὶ αἰών, ψυχὴ καὶ θυμός Hom.; τὸν δʼ ἔλιπε ψυχή, of one swooning, Il.; ψυχὴν παρθέμενος staking or risking oneʼs life, Od.; so, ἐμὴν ψυχὴν παραβαλλόμενος Il.; περὶ ψυχῆς for oneʼs life, i. e. to save it, Od.; μάχεσθαι, θέειν περὶ ψυχῆς Hom.; τρέχειν περὶ ψυχῆς Hdt.; ὁ περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς ἀγών the struggle is for life and death, Soph.; ποινὴν τῆς Αἰσώπου ψυχῆς ἀνελέσθαι to take revenge for the life of Aesop, Hdt.; ψυχὴν ἀφιέναι to give up the ghost, Eur.
metaph. of things dear as life, χρήματα γὰρ ψυχὴ βροτοῖσι Hes.; πᾶσι δʼ ἀνθρώποις ψυχὴ τέκνʼ ἐστί Eur.
the departed soul, spirit, ghost, Hom.

the soul or spirit of man, Lat. anima, opp. to σῶμα, Plat., Xen.:— ψυχή τινος, periphr. for the man himself, Soph.; also ψυχαί, souls, = ἄνθρωποι, Aesch., Ar.:—hence in addressing persons, ὦ μελέα ψυχή Soph.; ὦ ἀγαθὴ καὶ πιστὴ ψ. Xen.; πᾶσα ψυχὴ ὑποτασσέσθω let every soul be subject, NTest.
the soul, heart, ψυχὴν ἄριστε Ar.; ἐκ τῆς ψυχῆς with all the heart, Xen.
appetite, δοῦναί τι τῇ ψυχῇ, like Lat. indulgere animo, Aesch.
the soul, mind, understanding, ψυχὴν οὐκ ἄκρος Hdt.

div1.head: ψυχίδιον
div1.sense: animula, Luc.

div1.head: ψυχικός
div1.sense: of the soul or life, spiritual, opp. to σωματικός, Arist., Anth.
concerned with the life only, animal, ὁ ψ. ἄνθρωπος the natural man, opp. to ὁ πνευματικός, N. T

div1.head: ψυχοδαϊκτής
div1.sense: killing the soul, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχοδοτήρ
div1.sense: giver of the soul or life, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχολιπής
div1.sense: lifeless, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχομαχέω
div1.sense: to fight to the last gasp, fight desperately, Polyb.

div1.head: ψυχομαχία
div1.sense: desperate fighting, Polyb.

div1.head: ψυχοπλανής
div1.sense: making the soul wander, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχοπομπός
div1.sense: conductor of souls, of Charon, Eur.

div1.head: ψυχορραγέω
div1.sense: to let the soul break loose, i. e. to lie at the last gasp, Lat. animam agere, Eur.

div1.head: ψυχορραγής
div1.sense: letting the soul break loose, hence lying at the last gasp, Eur.

div1.head: ψῦχος
div1.sense: cold, ἐν ψύχει in winter-time, Soph.; ἐν τῷ ψύχει καθηῦδον in the cold, Plat.;— pl. ψύχεα, Attic ψύχη, Lat. frigora frosts, cold weather, Hdt., Xen.
coolness, cool, ψύχεος ἱμείρων Od.; metaph., ψ. ἐν δόμοις πέλει Aesch.

div1.head: ψυχοσσόος
div1.sense: saving the soul, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχοτακής
div1.sense: melting the soul, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχόω
div1.sense: to give life to, λίθον Anth.

div1.head: ψυχροδόχος
div1.sense: receiving what is cold, οἶκος ψ. the cold-bath room, Luc.

div1.head: ψυχρολογέω
div1.sense: to use frigid phrases, Luc.

div1.head: ψυχρολογία
div1.sense: frigid phraseology, Luc.

div1.head: ψυχρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to grow cold, be cool, Anth.

div1.head: ψυχρός
div1.sense: cold, chill, Il.; ψ. χαλκός (as we say "cold steel") Il.; of water, ψ. ὕδωρ Od., Thuc.; and ψυχρόν alone, ψυχρῷ λοῦνται Hdt.; of dead things, νέκυς Soph.; also τὸ ψυχρόν ψῦχος, cold, Soph.:—comp. -ότερος, Hdt., Plat.
metaph., Lat. frigidus,
of things and events, cold, unreal, ψ. ἐπικουρίη Hdt.; ἐπαρθεὶς ψυχρῇ νίκῃ Hdt.; ψ.παραγκάλισμα Soph.; ψυχρὰ τέρψις, ἐλπίς Eur.
of persons, cold-hearted, heartless, spiritless, Plat., Xen.
of language, cold, frigid, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ψυχρότης
div1.sense: coldness, cold, Plat.
metaph. of persons, coldness of heart, Dem.: sluggishness, Plut.

div1.head: ψύχω
div1.sense: to breathe, blow, ἦκα μάλα ψύξασα Il.
commonly, to make cold, cool, refrigerate, Hdt., Plat.:—Pass. to grow cold or cool, Hdt., Ar., etc.
to dry, make dry:— Pass., Xen.

div1.head: ψωλός
div1.sense: one circumcised, lewd, Ar.

div1.head: ψωμίζω
div1.sense: to feed with sops or tid-bits, Ar.:— Pass., οἷς ψωμίζεται with what tid-bits he is fed, Ar.
to employ in feeding others, τὰ ὑπάρχοντα NTest.

div1.head: ψωμός
div1.sense: a morsel, bit, ψωμοὶ ἀνδρόμεοι gobbets of manʼs flesh, Virgilʼs sanies ac frusta, Od.; also in Xen.

div1.head: ψωραλέος
div1.sense: scabby, mangy, Xen.

div1.head: ψώρα
div1.sense: the itch, scurvy, scab, mange, Lat. scabies, impetigo, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ψωράω
div1.sense: to have the itch, scab, or mange, Plat.

div1.head: ψώχω
div1.sense: to rub out, ψ. τὰς στάχυας NTest.
